entry.title: my way home is through you
entry.summary:
Author: irate_toast

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,719Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 38

Summary: Jason had given up his own mantle with the move out of Gotham nearly a year ago after long talks with Dick, his cape-friendly therapist and himself. He wasn‚Äôt sure if it was permanent yet, but for now Jason was content to keep himself busy with housework and the weighty task of filling the extra-bedroom-turned-library with books that suited his picky nature. It was oddly domestic and just a couple years ago Jason likely would have shot anyone who suggested this was where he would end up. Jason, now retired from the vigilante life, is thriving as a stay at home boyfriend. He cooks, cleans, reads and waits patiently for his boyfriend to return from work each day. entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 127,660Chapters: 26/42Kudos: 1,035

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham.Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave.The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running.Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother‚Äîthe one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human.Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

entry.title: the ghosts we leave behind
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,004Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 162

Summary: She had died in that suit. Bled in those colors. Burned for the symbol on her chest. And in less than six months Bruce had handed her place to someone else. Not another lost kid who knew the streets, who knew hunger and rage like she did. No. He‚Äôd chosen a boy. A boy with wealth, with schooling, with doors that had always been open to him. A boy who fit into Bruce‚Äôs world so easily, so seamlessly, while she had scraped and clawed for every scrap of approval. Everything she had never been good enough for‚ÄîTim Drake was, by default. The memory still cut. It always would. Because the Joker had lived. Because she had died. And because Bruce had moved on. Her lips curved into a smile, though there was nothing kind about it, her eyes glittering with something brittle. ‚ÄúSo you‚Äôre the one,‚Äù she said softly,¬†bitterly. ‚ÄúMy replacement.‚ÄùJane Todd came back to Gotham with a bang‚Äîor more accurately, the Joker‚Äôs head mounted on Arkham‚Äôs gates. It was only the beginning of the chaos she intended to bring.
